raw_comment: This graph is to show the comparison of young adults (15 to 24-year-olds) and middle-aged adults (40-year-old) and their amount of optimism for the future. The results highlight that the younger generations are much more optimistic about themselves and their future world, whilst the older generation believes that there is little hope for the future. This is concerning as it is worrying that the adults are so negative about our future, possibly meaning that they see a future that younger generations cannot see. I also observed that countries that are lower in socio-economical status and rely more on religion, such as Ethiopia, India and Indonesia, have a significantly higher percentage of young and old generations of adults with beliefs of improvement for our future generations.
ace_sentences: This graph shows a comparison between young adults and middle-aged adults.
A young adult is a person who is 15 years old or older and who is 24 years old or younger.
A middle-aged adult is a person who is 40 years old.
The graph shows the amount of optimism for the future.
The results highlight that young adults are much more optimistic about themselves.
The results highlight that young adults are much more optimistic about their future world.
The results highlight that middle-aged adults believe that there is little hope for the future.
It is worrying that middle-aged adults are so negative about our future.
This possibly means that middle-aged adults see a future that young adults cannot see.
These countries are lower in socio-economic status.
These countries rely more on religion.
In these countries, a significantly higher percentage of young adults have beliefs of improvement for our future generations.
In these countries, a significantly higher percentage of middle-aged adults have beliefs of improvement for our future generations.
